content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the interface components for copper cable production:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
• Secondary burner inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) (loaded with coal and awaiting source items)
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) (electrical_id=7106; warnings indicate lack of power and missing copper-plate)
• Lab with lab input {'automation-science-pack': 17} (electrical_id=7106; position not specified)

### Belt Depot at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Provides an isolated depot within the belt network:
• Wooden chest serving as belt depot at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Transport belt segment placed adjacent at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
• Dedicated depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP

### Extraction System at Position (–3.5, 27.5)
Supplies materials from the extraction area:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with drop position Position(x=–3.5, y=28.5)

### Electricity Generator at Position (–0.5, 24.5)
Provides power generation through a connected assembly:
• Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=–0.5, y=24.5)
• Boiler at Position(x=–5.5, y=24.0)
• Offshore pump at Position(x=–7.5, y=25.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Transport Belt Connection Error
 – Always connect transport belts to an appropriate inserter target rather than directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine object. Use an inserter as the intermediary to accept items.

• Placement Range Error
 – Confirm that the target location is within the allowed placement distance. If a placement fails due to excessive distance, move closer before attempting to place an entity.

• Inventory and Variable Reference Errors
 – Verify that the required entity (for example, a wooden chest) is available in inventory before placement.
 – Ensure that all referenced variables (such as the target chest) are correctly defined to avoid NameError issues.
